page.title: 16Footpaths
page.content: Footpaths are Public Rights of Way through fields and woods. Many are hundreds of years old. They link villages, hamlets, farms and workplaces e.g.the mill. To keep a footpath open it must be walked once a year. Brixton's Infants Class walked five footpaths in Brixton. Cherry Tree Drive - Catson Green. Bellows Park - Gorlofen Farm. Hollowcombe Brake - Spriddlestone - Torr. Torr - Cofflete Lodge, and Cofflete - Steer Point. Most paths were waymarked and in good order. The children found stiles, both wooden and stone, traces of old sunken lanes, a scratching stone for cattle and a tether stone for a bull. They passed the ruins of Cofflete House and found the site of the Old Mill (Stamps Lane).
